1.text: My son, forget not my teaching, and let thy heart observe my commandments;

2.text: for length of days, and years of life, and peace shall they add to thee.

3.text: Let not loving-kindness and truth forsake thee; bind them about thy neck, write them upon the tablet of thy heart:

4.text: and thou shalt find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.

5.text: Confide in Jehovah with all thy heart, and lean not unto thine own intelligence;

6.text: in all thy ways acknowledge him, and he will make plain thy paths.

7.text: Be not wise in thine own eyes; fear Jehovah, and depart from evil:

8.text: it shall be health for thy navel, and moisture for thy bones.

9.text: Honour Jehovah with thy substance, and with the first-fruits of all thine increase;

10.text: so shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy vats shall overflow with new wine.

11.text: My son, despise not the instruction of Jehovah, neither be weary of his chastisement;

12.text: for whom Jehovah loveth he chasteneth, even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.

13.text: Blessed is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.

14.text: For the gain thereof is better than the gain of silver, and her revenue than fine gold.

15.text: She is more precious than rubies; and all the things thou canst desire are not equal unto her.

16.text: Length of days is in her right hand; in her left hand riches and honour.

17.text: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.

18.text: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her; and happy is he that retaineth her.

19.text: Jehovah by wisdom founded the earth; by understanding he established the heavens.

20.text: By his knowledge the deeps were broken up, and the skies drop down the dew.

21.text: My son, let them not depart from thine eyes; keep sound wisdom and discretion:

22.text: so shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace unto thy neck.

23.text: Then shalt thou walk in thy way securely, and thy foot shall not stumble;

24.text: when thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid, but thou shalt lie down and thy sleep shall be sweet.

25.text: Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the destruction of the wicked, when it cometh;

26.text: for Jehovah shall be thy confidence, and he will keep thy foot from being taken.

27.text: Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thy hand to do it.

28.text: Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to-morrow I will give, when thou hast it by thee.

29.text: Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.

30.text: Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.

31.text: Envy not the man of violence, and choose none of his ways.

32.text: For the perverse is an abomination to Jehovah; but his secret is with the upright.

33.text: The curse of Jehovah is in the house of the wicked; but he blesseth the habitation of the righteous.

34.text: He indeed scorneth the scorners; but he giveth grace unto the lowly.

35.text: The wise shall inherit glory; but shame shall be the promotion of the foolish.
